pr_title: Fix bug related to canceling working copy removes approved resource (#5214)

timeline.message:
Fix bug related to canceling working copy removes approved resource (#5214)
store.delResources was not passing the correct approved flag.
Also fixed issue related to creating a working copy. It was not copying the resources correctly to the new metadata record. Wrong approved flag was being passed.

timeline.bodyText:
I would add some additional documentation explaining the usage of these parameters.
Seem oldApproved is always call with the value true, are there any cases where can be relevant to use the value false, if not maybe it can be removed and use only newApproved.
timeline.author: josegar74
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -40,18 +40,20 @@
      * @param context
      * @param oldMetadataId               The source metadata ID
      * @param newMetadataId               The destination metadata ID
+     * @param oldApproved                 Old approved flag to use for the source.
+     * @param newApproved                 New approved flag to use on the destination.

replies.bodyText:
In the existing code I don't believe there are cases for old approved being false.
The only possible case I can think of at the moment is if we were to add logic for duplicating a working copy (i.e a user may want to make a new metadata copy of their working copy before adding more changes.   In that case I believe the old approved would be false and the new approved would be true. But then the UUID would also need to change on the destination. I'm not sure if that case will ever exist?
I will remove the oldApproved and update the documentation as you suggested.
replies.author: ianwallen

timeline.message:
Removed oldApproved as it is always true.
Updated javadocs for newApproved
